headline: Peanut Butter Kiss Cookies
description: These peanut butter cookies with Hershey Kisses are easy to make. Topped with chocolate candy for a fast and tasty treat that kids and adults love.

video.description: See how to make an incredibly easy peanut butter and chocolate cookie.
video.name: Peanut Butter Kiss Cookies

name: Peanut Butter Kiss Cookies

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Stir together sugar, peanut butter, and egg in a mixing bowl until well combined.
Shape dough into 1-inch balls. If dough is too sticky, refrigerate until easy to handle, about 30 minutes.
Place dough balls on an ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until edges are set, about 10 minutes.
Press a chocolate kiss into the center of each warm cookie. Remove to a wire rack to cool.

review.reviewBody: ThÃ© original recipe was far too wet and sticky to roll a ball- I added a couple tablespoons of white flour which made a big difference. Also followed others advice and used half white and half brown sugar. I used half chunky and haLF smooth PB cause I like a bit of crunch but either would work. Also added a 1/2 tsp of vanilla. Kisses definitely need to be chilled before pressing them into warm cookie otherwise it is just a puddle of chocolate. Overall easy, very quick, and kid approved!

All recipes has never failed me, but as the old saying go and it only takes one time and this was it! So disappointed and save your ingredients as this was a major fail! Wish I had thought to read the reviews before I attempted this recipe. In trash it went that alone speaks volume!

There are some missing steps that really would have helped. First this was way too sweet. Next time Iâ€™d cut the sugar down to at least 3/4 or maybe even 1/3 c. The dough was so sticky so I had to add extra 1/8-1/4 c flour. It was so soft that I chilled it in the fridge. The 350 in my oven is a bit high but thatâ€™s no fault of the recipe. The bottoms were getting done way to fast so I had to turn it down to 325. I also chilled the Hershey Kisses so they did not completely melt. Simple recipe but need some tweaks to make it better!
Made these exactly as per recipe. Baked on parchment paper on top of a baking stone. Sooo delicious!!! I hope they last for two days, itâ€™s our Christmas party.
These cookies came out beyond greasy. This recipe was a fail.
love it. sometimes use differant candies
This was a very easy recipe and it is very delicious.

Amazing! Pretty sure my mother made these same cookies before ages ago. This was the exact recipe I was searching for. I didnâ€™t realize it was just peanut butter, sugar and egg. I used half brown and half white and put little Hershey squares in them, not kisses. I expected an oogie mess but got perfectly round plump slightly browned cookies, soft enough to plant the square of chocolate. Very rich and a bit too sweet but YUM.

I was dubious, but the recipe totally works. I took some tips from other reviewers. Froze the Kisses and used half brown and half white sugar. I used a runny PB, still good. I always put cookie dough in the fridge for 30 minutes (at least). I ate one while it was warm...oh dear. I instantly wanted to eat the rest of the cookies. So darn yummy. They're delicious cool too. THANK YOU!!
yum thanks they are the best cookies i ever had!
Love these!! Everyone enjoyed them ðŸ˜Š
Iâ€™ve made these a few times and they are so easy and very delicious!

I have no idea how some people felt this recipe came out... yea sure add stuff a some reviewers suggest but it's not in the recipe. This was horrible and I had to add everything possible to make it not just eating peanut butter mixed with sugar. Find a better peanut butter blossom recipe elsewhere.
My cookies fell apart and were much too sweet. It figures. I thought the ease of the recipe was too good to be true.
delicious
Greasy, easy to burn, no good
This recipe is amazing. 10/10. Would bake this again! I prefer to make these cookies over any others.

A really good recipe but here are a few things you should know.
- DON'T make these if you have time to make the more complex peanut butter cookies. these don't taste bad, but traditional peanut butter cookies are MUCH better.
- Bake them for 15-20 minutes, not 10.
- Add chocolate chips, they taste bland and plain otherwise.

- if you make tablespoon-sized cookies, this recipe makes about 20 cookies NOT 9.
Itâ€™s great! But if this is your first ever time you DEFINITELY need to minus the sugar A LOT!
I added 1-1.5 tablespoons of flour to make it a little easier to work with. Turned out perfectly!
it was great to mack

Taste wonderful... (used half brown and half white sugar)
Although Ichilled the dough but they still spread and looked terrible.
Will try the triple sugar method next time and add some flour.
Should have read the reviews before making them.
SÃºper easy is what Iâ€™m all about ! Four ingredients including the kisses
I had trouble determining what was a 1" ball. I would recommend if you aren't an experienced baker to use a small scoop instead. Also, I found cherry cordial creme & mint kisses this holiday season
Super easy to make and remind me of my childhood.

This recipe was definitely quick and easy and thatâ€™s what I was looking for. I hate baking because of all the measuring and ingredients needed so this was right up my alley. I took the advice from all the others with using sugar, brown sugar, powdered sugar and even adding just a little bit of flour and then rolling them in sugar before baking. I cooked them for about 12 minutes and they came out perfectly. I put the kisses in the fridge prior to help prevent them from melting which seemed to work great. As for the taste, I have 3 stars because it just tasted overwhelmingly of peanut butter. Like I was eating a warm peanut butter mush. Good, but just overwhelming and a little too sweet. I will wait for them to completely cool and try again. I like my cookies when they are completely cooled rather than fresh hot out of the oven.
Loved it!
I added the 1/4 cup of flour like the other comments said they were great. My family and I loved them. personally I will probably use less sugar next time
These cookies are amazing and easy to do always a family favourite
Not bad, needed about 5 extra minutes thought.
Very easy and very good!
So easy! This will be my go to peanbutter cookie recipe from now on
We love these in our house. Simple recipe with ingredients we always have on hand.

This recipe is bomb proof and I have made some brown sugar subs and still great professional cook for 30+ years so I can't help but play with recipes a bit!
Cheerios
The most delicious peanut butter cookie recipe you'll ever find.

This is exactly the pb cookie recipe my mom made growing up. So nice to discover you can still use it for the PB Kiss Cookies. Gotta love a recipe that you can memorize and don't have to look up everytime. I also love that it makes a small quantity of cookies; all the other recipes are for 5 dozen or so.
Super easy to make!
Absolutely delish! I rolled in sugar to make them instantly rollable but that was the only change I made! We got 21 cookies out of this recipe.
Excellent and easy to make!!
Super easy and delicious!
Simple and delicious! Made them for my granddaughter who is gluten free. Hope they last until she comes!
I made more then it told me it would make 9 I got 29 instead.
holy cow these are tasty I went with the 1/3 cup of sugar , brown sugar and powder sugar I used half cup of honey peanutbutter creamy and half cup of chunky peanutbutter highly recommend making these
My grandchildren requested these for Christmas. I have made these several times. I do as other 1/3 each white, brown and powdered sugar.
Came out great! I had to add a minute to the time... But they came out delicious and soft! I also found these hot chocolate kisses that I used! Yum!!
Love these cookies. I roll them in green or red sugar for Christmas

Gritty, crumbly, just not what I was expecting at all. So disappointed! It seems like all the people who like the recipe made significant changes or substitutions, I wish I had realized that before making this.
This is a great and easy recipe!
dough tases like carrots. one star could't eat it.
This recipe was so easy and delicious will definitely make again.
The best and no flour!

I followed the recipe EXACTLY as written and they were PERFECT!! No need for powdered sugar or extra flour. So, my review for THIS recipe is definitely 5 stars. 

As for how long to bake them, that will always depend on YOUR oven. Know your oven. Do a test batch with 4 cookies at the suggested time to see if you need to increase or decrease baking time.

I used to use this recipe for regular (press down the top) peanut butter cookies, and even substituted Splenda to make them low-sugar. The Splenda version is ok, but definitely not as good!
When I did it this time, I used another reviewerâ€™s suggestion and did 1/3 c white sugar, 1/3 c brown sugar and 1/3 c confectioners sugar. 
They were perfect. My mom has had her original recipe (with flour and Crisco, etc) for decades and said she might do them this way now!
I may try adding a little vanilla next time, but overall, itâ€™s a solid, easy gluten-free recipe! Two thumbs up!

Turned out great! I used 1/3 cup each white sugar, brown sugar, powdered sugar, and added 1/4 cup flour, since a lot of reviewers seemed to have done that. Very simple recipe, and looks great at the end!
Amazing! amazing! love these cooking! I have to say I was a little skeptical of the recipe at first but they turned out great!
I made it as the recipe stated. Theyâ€™re a big hit!
Very simple, we had fun making them. This is an excellent Christmas cookie. Stores well in the freezer.
It was easy and quick to make.

Super easy. I made these exactly as the recipe states because what good would my review be of THIS recipe if
I changed things up?

Comments:

We wrapped dough and placed in freezer for 20 min. This made rolling easier as the dough gets crumbly as it warms so roll quickly.

Unwrap kisses and set them in freezer while cookies bake. Took this idea from another comment and it is brilliant! 

These look raw after 10 min but take them out and press the kiss on them. They finish cooking on the 
Cookie sheet with no melting issues at all!

They are rich but I expected this based on the ingredients. One cookie satisfies a sweet tooth.
So so yummy!
I will definitely make this again! I would recommend making a double batch though. My cookies didn't look as pretty and were slightly crumbly, but that is because I used natural peanut butter.

Oh my goodness....these were the most delicious, decadent, soft, peanut buttery cookies I have ever had! And the best part, they are super simple to make! So simple, in fact, that my 8 year old made them all by herself. I was going to help, but when I saw all the steps and ingredients needed, I knew she could do them herself. The only thing we did differently was to add caramel filled kisses to the top. I would highly recommend this. It added a new texture and flavor to the whole thing that really enhanced it.
I had to bake these 50% longer and they still did not flatten out like the ones in the video!

Easy!
Delicious !
This was an easy recipe and everyone loved the cookies. I made them a few days before Valentine's Day so instead of dipping the cookies in white sugar, I substituted red candy sugar.
Fantastic! As good as they look. Simple, straight-forward recipe that makes a classic. Made them for 2018 Christmas cookie trays and will do so again in 2019. Just perfect cookies.

SUPER EASY! This is the absolute best peanut butter kiss recipe i have found. The simplicity, and impressively delicious outcome combined makes this probably the best thing I've ever called homemade! Thank you for Sharing! -- Also, I paired these with a raspberry jelly filled butter cookie and told everyone over the holidays that i made "peanut butter & jelly cookies" ;) ( really, it is fruit preserve in the cookies. It's just funner to say jelly.)

They turned out wonderful! With making a double batch I used one cup white sugar and one cup brown sugar, I also used the starburst chocolates instead of kisses. I read from someone elseâ€™s review that the brown sugar would keep them softer and it did! I liked that there was no flour in this recipe. Iâ€™m sharing the recipe with my family. The cookies were a holiday hit.
Consistency was runny, added 3/4 c. flour. Baked for 10 minutes and they spread - a lot. Won't waste my peanut butter on this again.
Taste good but not as fluffy as we would like
Added 1 tsp vanilla. Very easy, quick, and delicious. Yielded 22 cookies. Make sure to let cookies cool on cookie sheet before moving to cooling rack. Thanks Sharon for the recipe!
Fastest, easiest cookies to make. Delicious exactly as stated in the recipe.

Very yummy cookie. I also followed another substitution suggested by someone else (thank you!). I tripled the recipe to share cookies with my friends. 1 cups sugar, 1 cup brown sugar, 1 cup confectioners sugar. I also had to cook them for 12 minutes and they still came out nice and chewy.

I decided to make mine like peanut butter blossoms made by Karlynn Johnston. I added butter, flour, baking soda and powder. I also rolled them in sugar before baking them. This is how my mom made them growing up.
I make these every year with mini reese, yum yum.
The only substitution I made was to roll the balls in more sugar. These do not taste like the classic variety. They are okay but I would not make them again. They taste eggy. Not quite right.
super easy and delicious
This is so wrong! Whereâ€™s the flour etc!
They turn out awesome I use brown sugar
My Grand daughter and I make these all the time, the turn out great
Quick & easy! Oh and yummy!!

I used a combo of brown sugar, confectioners sugar and white sugar, which was good. I stuck the kisses into the cookies too soon and they started to melt. Next time I will wait a few minutes before using the kisses.
An excellent last-minute cookie or if you need something and don't know how to do anything else. Made this recipe exactly like it's written and it never lets me down. The best go-to cookie.

So my picture did not work last time. Are used a triple batch. Used one cup powdered sugar 1 cup brown sugar 1 cup white sugar and 3 teaspoons of vanilla. 
 I might reduce the peanut butter by 1/2 cup next time. I also used chocolate stars But really good and Not dry
Baked up great! This recipe is a keeper. I don't roll the balls in sugar before baking because I don't care for the sugar texture, but other than that I made no changes.

I made this recipe as one reviewer suggested to triple it using 1 cup sugar, one cup brown sugar and 1 cup confectioner's sugar (swerve) and it was great and allowed me to cut back about 1/3 sugar this way.
Recipe was great as written!
Very quick and easy recipe! Taste DELICIOUS! I've already made them twice and it was great
DO NOT USE STORE GROUND PEANUT BUTTER
super easy and quick to make! I LOVE peanut butter and I've tried them with chunky and honey toasted they came out really good. they also stay soft even after cooling so that's nice??
Added more natural peanut butter. The oil helped with moisture. They were pretty good. I made these because they were gluten free and quick.

I followed some of the review suggestions and used 1/3 c white sugar, 1/3 c brown sugar, and 1/3 c confectioner's. Actually, I made a triple batch, but that's the ration I used. :) These were a big hit!

These came out perfectly for me! My family loves them.

But I do have a rather silly question. The recipe yields 18 cookies so two per person which equals the serving size of 9. My question is, does the Nutrition value of 311 calories equal the two cookies, or is that just for one? I'm trying to determine what my Weight Watchers value for this would be. 

I appreciate anyone's response!

I used the three different sugars and put them in for 8, put in the kiss, and then another 2. They are soft and yummy (and so easy). I would recommend letting them cool on the pan or else theyâ€™re kinda too gooey. They donâ€™t look as wonderful as I hoped theyâ€™d be (they cracked a bit), but overall this recipe is a keeper. Thank you!!
These cookies were made following the original recipe. They were too sweet to eat. Glad that I tried one, because now I won't be bringing them to Christmas Eve dinner. Yuck.

I make these every Christmas for my mother who has a gluten allergy. They're so easy to make I use chunky peanut butter to add a bit more crunch and I use a small ice cream scoop. I just spray the scoop with a little Pam, it's so easy. No mess no fuss

I've never liked these cookies and my boyfriend begged me to make some for Christmas. I found this recipe and its absolutely fantastic! So delicious. I made my own peanut butter in the bulk food department of the grocery store. Fresh and flavorful. I used half icing sugar and half brown sugar. Rolled in sugar crystals before putting kisses on top. Beautiful, easy and devour able!
Loved the first reviewerâ€™s recipe alterations. So easy and chewy!
Turned out prefect I 4X the recipe and they look and taste amazing!!!
